freenet.node
Interface OutgoingPacketMangler

All Known Implementing Classes:
FNPPacketMangler
public interface OutgoingPacketMangler

Low-level interface for sending packets. A UDP-based transport will have to implement both this and IncomingPacketFilter, usually on the same class.

See Also:
IncomingPacketFilter, FNPPacketMangler

Method Detail

processOutgoingOrRequeue

boolean processOutgoingOrRequeue(MessageItem[] messages,
                                 PeerNode pn,
                                 boolean dontRequeue,
                                 boolean onePacketOnly)
                                 throws BlockedTooLongException
Build one or more packets and send them, from a whole bunch of messages. If any MessageItem's are formatted already, they will be sent as single packets. Any packets which cannot be sent will be requeued on the PeerNode.

Parameters:
onePacketOnly - If true, we will only send one packet, and will requeue any messages that don't fit in that single packet.
Returns:
True if we sent a packet.
Throws:
BlockedTooLongException

resend

void resend(ResendPacketItem item,
            SessionKey kt)
            throws PacketSequenceException,
                   WouldBlockException,
                   KeyChangedException,
                   NotConnectedException
Resend a single packet.

Parameters:
kt - The SessionKey on which to send the packet.
Throws:
PacketSequenceException
WouldBlockException
KeyChangedException
NotConnectedException

processOutgoing

int processOutgoing(byte[] buf,
                    int offset,
                    int length,
                    SessionKey tracker,
                    short priority)
                    throws KeyChangedException,
                           NotConnectedException,
                           PacketSequenceException,
                           WouldBlockException
Build a packet and send it. From a Message recently converted into byte[], but with no outer formatting.

Returns:
Total size including UDP headers of the sent packet.
Throws:
PacketSequenceException
WouldBlockException
KeyChangedException
NotConnectedException

processOutgoingPreformatted

int processOutgoingPreformatted(byte[] buf,
                                int offset,
                                int length,
                                SessionKey tracker,
                                int packetNumber,
                                AsyncMessageCallback[] callbacks,
                                short priority)
                                throws KeyChangedException,
                                       NotConnectedException,
                                       PacketSequenceException,
                                       WouldBlockException
Encrypt a packet, prepend packet acks and packet resend requests, and send it. The provided data is ready-formatted, meaning that it already has the message length's and message counts.

Parameters:
buf - Buffer to read data from.
offset - Point at which to start reading.
length - Number of bytes to read.
tracker - The SessionKey to use to encrypt the packet and send it to the associated PeerNode.
packetNumber - If specified, force use of this particular packet number. Means this is a resend of a dropped packet.
Returns:
The size of the sent packet.
Throws:
NotConnectedException - If the node is not connected.
KeyChangedException - If the primary key changes while we are trying to send this packet.
PacketSequenceException
WouldBlockException - If we cannot allocate a packet number because it would block.

sendHandshake

void sendHandshake(PeerNode pn,
                   boolean notRegistered)
Send a handshake, if possible, to the node.

Parameters:
pn -

Port forwarding status.

allowConnection

boolean allowConnection(PeerNode node,
                        FreenetInetAddress addr)
Is there any reason not to allow this connection? E.g. limits on the number of nodes on a specific IP address?

setPortForwardingBroken

void setPortForwardingBroken()
If the lower level code detects the port forwarding is broken, it will call this method.
